intro: Rourea carvalhoi, commonly known as the Carvalho's rourea, is a flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and alternate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are often green or yellowish in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
